policies.title: Secure Development Lifecycle for Application Security
policies.policy_text: The organization shall embed security into the software development lifecycle (SDLC) from design to deployment and operations. All new features must undergo threat modeling during design, and secure coding standards must be enforced through automated SAST checks in CI/CD. All code changes must pass secure code reviews with security sign-off prior to production deployment. Static and dynamic security testing (SAST and DAST) shall be performed in development and pre-production environments, with results tracked in a remediation workflow. Vulnerabilities identified (especially injection and scripting flaws) must be prioritized and remediated before release, and developers shall receive ongoing secure coding training. Security requirements shall be documented in project charters and traceable through to production live environments.
vulnerabilities: SQL Injection vulnerability detected in routes/search.js (Semgrep SAST, HIGH, line 45)
XSS vulnerability detected in routes/profile.js (Semgrep SAST, HIGH, line 23)
SQL Injection may be possible discovered by OWASP ZAP (DAST, HIGH)

implementation_requirements: Integrate SAST/DAST into CI/CD pipelines for all applications
Adopt threat modeling as a standard design activity for new features
Document and enforce secure coding standards in development guidelines
Mandate secure code reviews with security sign-off before production
Maintain a vulnerability remediation backlog with SLAs by severity
Provide ongoing secure coding training for developers
verification_methods: Review CI/CD SAST/DAST configurations and results
Audit threat modeling artifacts and sign-offs
Inspect code review records and security sign-off status
Verify remediation backlog and SLA adherence

policies.title: Security Testing in Software Development and Acceptance
policies.policy_text: All software changes shall undergo comprehensive security testing in development and acceptance environments before production deployment. The testing program must include SAST, DAST, and manual security testing for critical components, with test results recorded and linked to remediation actions. Critical and high-risk vulnerabilities identified during testing must be fixed and re-tested prior to production release. Testing coverage shall be documented, and acceptance criteria must explicitly include security controls and pass criteria. Security testing findings must feed back into the SDLC for continuous improvement.
vulnerabilities: SQL Injection vulnerability detected in routes/search.js (Semgrep SAST, HIGH, line 45)
XSS vulnerability detected in routes/profile.js (Semgrep SAST, HIGH, line 23)
SQL Injection may be possible (OWASP ZAP DAST, HIGH)
Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) detected (OWASP ZAP DAST, HIGH)
implementation_requirements: Enforce CI/CD gates requiring SAST and DAST pass with remediation for HIGH/CRITICAL findings
Ensure staging/acceptance environments mimic production for accurate testing
Establish formal security acceptance criteria tied to deployment approvals
Maintain test evidence and defect tracking across remediation cycle
Schedule periodic penetration testing for high-risk applications
verification_methods: Review security test reports and remediation evidence
Verify that no HIGH/CRITICAL findings remain unresolved prior to deployment
Audit testing coverage across all code paths and components
Verify that production deployments follow security acceptance criteria

policies.title: Technical Vulnerability Management for Third-Party Components
policies.policy_text: The organization shall implement a formal technical vulnerability management program for third-party components and libraries. Maintain an up-to-date software bill of materials (SBOM) for all software, identify vulnerable versions (e.g., npm packages), and apply remediation within defined SLAs based on severity. Integrate Software Composition Analysis (SCA) into CI/CD to continuously monitor dependencies (including Express and jsonwebtoken). Remediation progress must be tracked, with re-testing performed after patches. Establish exception processes for non-remediable risks and document risk acceptance where necessary.
implementation_requirements: Enable and enforce SCA in CI/CD (e.g., npm audit, Snyk, or equivalent) for all dependencies
Maintain an SBOM and inventory of all third-party libraries
Define and enforce patching SLAs by severity (e.g., Critical/High within 24-72 hours, Medium within 7-14 days)
Automate remediation tracking and re-testing after patches
Establish a process to evaluate and approve exceptions for critical components
verification_methods: Review dependency scan results and SBOM records
Audit patch deployment timelines and remediation statuses
Verify re-testing and closure of remediation tickets

policies.title: Information Security in Supplier Relationships
policies.policy_text: The organization shall manage information security risks arising from supplier relationships, including ICT supply chain dependencies. Security requirements must be defined in procurement contracts, with rights to audit, ongoing monitoring of supplier security posture, and clear expectations for vulnerability remediation. Suppliers providing software components must supply security documentation (e.g., SBOMs, vulnerability management commitments) and adhere to security testing practices. Third-party software components used by applications shall be subject to security assessment and ongoing monitoring aligned with organizational risk tolerance.
implementation_requirements: Incorporate security requirements into supplier contracts and procurement documentation
Require SBOMs and evidence of vulnerability management from suppliers
Include security testing and remediation obligations in supplier SLAs
Implement ongoing supplier security assessments and monitoring
Establish rights to audit supplier security practices
verification_methods: Review supplier contracts and security annexes
Check for SBOM availability and vulnerability management evidence
Audit supplier remediation performance and incident response
Verify ongoing supplier security monitoring dashboards
